results.title: Benjamin Smoke
results.creator_credit: C-Hundred Film Corporation, Cowboy Booking International, Gravity Hill Films, Pumpernickel, Jem Cohen and Peter Sillen
results.brief_description: This American documentary focuses on songwriter, composer and singer, Benjamin (born Robert Dickerson) over the course of ten years as he negotiates the music scene hoping to make a name for himself and maintain the status quo of his life. Benjamin is an underground musician, speed freak, occasional drag queen and HIV+ homosexual man playing punk, fronting the queer-core band Opal Foxx Quartet before forming the blues-oriented band Smoke. Benjamin is from Cabbagetown, Atlanta, home of the go-cart and a mill town where, in Benjamin’s youth, people were poor and drugs and hustlers were in abundance. Extensive interviews with Benjamin are revelatory and deeply personal as he discusses his drug intake, creative urges, sex, gay politics, being HIV+, death and his life’s ambitions. Footage of Benjamin performing live and in the studio shows him to be a talented artist, who sings in a style similar to Tom Waits. This compassionate portrait is quite riveting and fairly down-beat but is also an inspiring chronicle of the human spirit. Jem Cohen and Peter Sillen flesh out the context of Benjamin’s upbringing by examining the social strata of Cabbagetown, an under-ground haven and seedy white-trash neighbourhood before being yuppified in the 1990s. Features a guest appearance by Patti Smith, an artist who inspired Benjamin, and in the bonus footage, a live performance from Chan Marshall, aka Cat Power.

results.title: Benjamin Franklin
results.brief_description: Covers Franklin’s youth, commercial success, experiences in London, and his political career, culminating in his Presidency of the United States of America. No other credits available.

results.title: Benito Cereno
results.brief_description:
In 1799, the Santo Domingo is sailing to Peru, when a slave mutiny erupts on board. Only seven crew members survive, including the Captain, Benito Cereno. The leader of the mutiny, Atimbo, wants to sail back to Africa. When the ship encounters troubles, an American vessel comes to the rescue. Cereno explains that his crew has taken ill with scurvy, including the human cargo imported from Africa. The slaves are down to only a few healthy men and Cereno is awaiting the right

Credits: Director, Serge Roullet ; writer, Serge Roullet ; photography, Ricardo Arronovitch.
Cast: Ruy Guerra, Georges Selmark, Temour Diop, Jacques Mercier, John Turner, Serge Roullet, Philippe Noury.

results.title: Beni Abbes: science in the desert
results.brief_description: Beni Abbes is a Scientific Research Centre, set up in the Sahara by the French. This film shows some of he work being done, in an effort to make the desert fertile once more. Test growing of plants, the use of wind to drive pumps which draw water from below the sand, and an experimental station which aims to harness the sun’s heat to produce power are some of the activities shown.

results.title: Beneficient reprobate: ethyl alcohol, its nature and properties
results.creator_credit: Burton Holmes Films and Elmer Clifton
results.brief_description: Sponsored by the Women’s Christian Temperance Union, this film deals with the industrial uses of alcohol, and the effects of alcohol on the central nervous system of the human body. Produced from Bertha Rachel Palmer’s “A Syllabus in Alcohol Education”.

results.title: Benedictus
results.brief_description: A mood film which attempts to convey the passage of human life. Simple still nature photography is used to illustrate the theme, with the camera focussing and de-focussing on the subject. A lyrical flute accompaniment gives emphasis to this quiet unassuming film. No other credits available.

results.title: Beneath the dream
results.creator_credit: Nihon Hoso Kyokai, UNICEF and Peter Pastorelle
results.brief_description: Fuku and Lee are two young Chinese women helping underprivileged youngsters on the island of Hong Kong. One teaches the island’s many working children at a part-time school. The other runs a mobile library (supplied by UNICEF) bringing books, a chance for recreation and learning, to children living along the shores in sampans.

results.title: Beneath our feet. Parts 1-3
results.creator_credit: TV Ed Productions and Bob Scarfe
results.brief_description: The Scenery of Victoria looks at the landforms throughout the state and relates the actual location to its geological significance. “Geological history of Victoria” Very similar to Part 1, but made for year 10 science with more emphasis on the period of history each geological type fits into. “Granite” looks at the formation and coding processes that produce granite with emphasis on the seven types of rocks that are currently associated with granite.

results.title: Bending and reflecting sunlight
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Warren Brown
results.brief_description: Three boys, experimenting with everyday objects, discover the phenomena of refraction and reflection. Playing with a magnifying glass, a water-filled jar, and hose spray, they begin to grasp the principles of magnification, bent images, and rainbows, as they see light interacting with various materials. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Bendigo pottery
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education, Trevor Lunn and Brendan Kenworthy
results.brief_description: This program gives some insight into the process involved in making pottery and shows some of the types of clay used, the preparation, pot throwing and glazing at the Bendigo pottery.
